title: Boston meteorologists say Monday’s storm is ‘trending toward a miss’
author: John Waller
bullets: Monday's storm is likely to miss Boston as it trends farther south and east offshore.
Meteorologists report a more seasonable and dry weather pattern into the holiday weekend, with milder temperatures next week.
Flurries and snow showers are expected near the Boston coast, but significant impacts from Monday's storm are unlikely.

title: 5 best new restaurant openings and dining updates in Boston (Feb. 12, 2026)
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: A second Citrus & Salt is opening in Burlington with an expansive patio scheduled for Summer 2026.
Moro Mou will blend Greek and Japanese cuisines at a 15-seat omakase spot in Seaport, opening Summer 2026.
The Down Low offers a cocktail experience in Woburn with live entertainment and is currently open.

title: Nikola Vucevic, Celtics roll into All-Star break with blowout win over Bulls: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Nikola Vucevic scored 19 points and 11 rebounds off the bench as the Celtics defeated the Bulls 124-105.
The Celtics showcased strong offensive dynamics with Vucevic's versatility, facilitating plays and stretching the floor.
The Celtics went into the All-Star break with momentum, holding a one-game lead over the Knicks in the standings.

title: ‘Modern day concentration camp’: Irish man living in Boston area has been in ICE detention for 5 months
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Irish man Seamus Culleton held in ICE custody for 5 months after overstaying visa since 2009.
Culleton described poor conditions at the ERO East Montana ICE Detention Camp in El Paso, Texas.
Culleton's lawyer seeks exemption for green card as he's married to a U.S. citizen and poses no flight risk.

title: Will Patriots move on from Stefon Diggs? Maye says WR has a lot ‘left in the tank’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Stefon Diggs' $20.6 million salary in 2026 isn't guaranteed, saving Patriots up to $20.8 million if released.
Diggs, facing legal issues, denies assault charges and has court date set for this Friday.
Drake Maye praises Diggs' contributions and believes he has more to offer despite age and past injuries.

title: Watch: Maynard police, fire crews save dog from ‘pet owner’s worst nightmare’
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Maynard police and fire crews rescued a dog that fell through ice at Mill Pond on Tuesday night.
Emergency responders used a drone to assist fire crews during the rescue operation, completing it in under ten minutes.
The dog, named Rufus, returned home safely with no serious injuries after the quick response from emergency teams.

title: Signal issues cause multiple delays and cancellations on at least 6 commuter rail lines
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Signal issues on Wednesday caused delays on all 12 commuter rail lines, with some trains delayed up to 50 minutes.
Over 25 commuter rail trains were canceled due to the signal issues impacting the system throughout the day.
A separate power issue on the Blue Line required shuttle buses from Orient Heights to Wonderland until service resumed.

title: Former Worcester councilor found guilty of assault on police officer related to ICE arrest
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Etel Haxhiaj, former Worcester councilor, was found guilty of assaulting a police officer and sentenced to six months probation.
Haxhiaj was acquitted of interfering with a police officer during the 2025 ICE arrest incident in Worcester, Massachusetts.
The case was prosecuted by the Northwestern District Attorney due to a conflict of interest with the Worcester DA's office.

title: JetBlue lounge at Logan Airport will make its debut this summer
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: JetBlue's BlueHouse BOS lounge will open in Terminal C at Logan Airport near gate C23 this summer.
The 11,000 sq ft Boston lounge will feature local art, food, and design, with residential-style amenities.
JetBlue's Logan Airport lounge will be 40% larger than its 8,000 sq ft JFK lounge opened in December 2025.

title: ESPN predicts Patriots will target offensive lineman with 1st-round pick in 2026 NFL Draft
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: ESPN predicts Patriots will draft Utah's offensive lineman Caleb Lomu in the first round of the 2026 NFL Draft.
Lomu, a 6-foot-6, 304-pound tackle, allowed no sacks in 2025 and can also play as a guard.
Despite support for current left tackle Will Campbell, Patriots aim to reinforce their offensive line after Super Bowl LX loss.
